title: Looking for a glyph from a contemporary typeface with a convincing "beak"
content:
I’m finishing the design on my personal New Year’s Card — _me? late? naaah!_ — and am still not very happy with one detail.

I need two characters which feature a convincing [beak](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/desktoppub.about.com/cs/typeanatomy/g/beak.htm) — _“a type of decorative stroke at the end of the arm of a letter, usually more pronounced than a spur or serif”,_ but you all knew that of course. ;^)

Rather than use ITC Fenice or ITC Tiffany or something obvious like that, can anybody suggest an interesting contemporary typeface with pronounced serifs that has such a glyph, and more importantly, send me those two characters in outline form? I _will_ ask the designer of the typeface the proper permission to use them, don’tchaworry.

THX a bunch.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [HappyNewYear2006.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/typophile.com/files/HappyNewYear2006.pdf) | 634.91 KB |

 [‹ Expedia swipes valuable luggage?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/typophile.com/node/18031 "Go to previous forum topic") [I have a type tool question ??? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/typophile.com/node/18007 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content:
I seem to remember Hrant having a typeface design (or partial design?) with some very pronounced spikes (if that is what you mean).

ChrisL

[http://www.themicrofoundry.com/f\_brutaal.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/www.themicrofoundry.com/f_brutaal.html "http://www.themicrofoundry.com/f\_brutaal.html")

Do you mean this one Chris?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/viktorsraven-ef/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/viktorsraven-ef/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/viktorsraven-ef/")

Not really what you want but it does have beaks

Yup Tim, that is the brutal truth :-) I don’t know what Yves has in mind—that might be over the top for him but it sure has pronounced beaks!  
Your suggestion really sings with a feathery touch though. I don’t know if it will fly in Yves eyes.:-)

ChrisL
Try Warnock Display, or some of F. Storm’s stabby faces (Aichel, Libcziowes, Mramor).

Here’s a monster beak on an expressionist alphabet I drew  
(ala pressig, though even more reduced).

Lemmeknow if you want it and I’ll send an eps.

Randy

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821im_/http:/typophile.com/files/a.gif)
Randy, where’s the rest of this face?

Storm’s [Traktoretka](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/www.stormtype.com/trakto.html)? i have it and can send a glyph.

-marian

<cite>Randy, where’s the rest of this face?</cite>  
Tiffany, I’ve been diagnosed with a genetic disease called TDADD\*

Most of the lowercase is sitting on my hardrive amongst the rest of the mostly completed lowercases in a mostly completed lowercase pile. It is more of a digital sketchbook.

R  
\*Type design attention deficit disorder.
Storm’s [Negro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/negro/negro/)
Emigre: Base 12 Serif, Matrix (so uncool it’s cool again?), Quartet, Totally Gothic

Heh, like _Zuzana_’s gonna allow me to use two glyphs?

Heh.

Heh heh...

BWAAAAA-HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA! :^D
Thanks everyone — the cavalry came and gave me just what I needed. I’ll post the result when it’s ready. ;^)

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Beaky.jpg)
  
Merlin: possibly a little too literal an interpretation of the brief.
LOL :^D

Nick, that Merlin of yours is real cutting edge type design :-)

ChrisL

Beaks rule. Horns too.

Yves, where’s the results?

hhp

I laserprinted the first 50 copies and am in the process of folding them by hand. It’s a two-sided A3-poster (297 x 420 mm) folded in eight to the size of a postcard — the English side entitled “A Tiny Treasury of Typographic Terms”, the Dutch side being “Enkele Trefwoorden uit de Typografische Praktijk”.

BTW I eventually went for Warnock Pro, which has very nice beaks but still is a rather conventional text face.

I’ll upload a screen-friendly PDF of the English side in the original post.

Sorry Yves, but I couldn’t help it

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821im_/http:/typophile.com/files/troubleman.jpg)
  
Have a very happy new year… and a belated happy birthday

Richard

EDIT: while looking for a suitable picture of Neil Innes, I saw this:  
<cite>When asked to describe where he is musically, Neil says, “I’m keeping up with the Jones’s… Right now, I’m somewhere between Spike and Norah.”</cite>
Ooops, post ghost, how did that happen… ?

Neil Innes’s hairline is just about the same as Yves’ (and mine) :-)

ChrisL
Hey, this is cool! My fold-out poster is featured on [MS Typo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/links/news.aspx?NID=5442)! :^)

BTW Yves, I showed the piece to my class last week - naturally  
they loved it. My point? An ominous example of how type can  
permeate even one’s family life! :-) Like here too, in Catalonia:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821im_/http:/typophile.com/files/torre.jpg)

Speaking of Catalonia, apparently there’s an Olympic  
snowboarder named Jordi Font! We should recruit him  
as a mascot or something.

hhp

Hrant,  
Perhaps Jordi would be too typecast as our mascot :-)

Glad to see a picture of your son! He has the family bouma :-)

ChrisL

Typo treasure  
_Ahhhhhhhh, pieces of lead_

[Another candidate for mascot](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180821/http:/www.footballdatabase.com/site/players/index.php?dumpPlayer=688)

Tim

LOL!!! Go Wilfred! :-)

ChrisL
